episodes.title: Dedicated to the Devastated
episodes.description:
Sharing excerpts from Gene Edwards' book "Letters to a Devastated Christian, Healing for the Brokenhearted," I hope to offer some clarity to believers who may have been, or who may be, in an authoritarian Christian movement. I was, and it can be so heartbreaking; it was for me. 

Gene Edwards shares some characteristics and damaging effects of authoritarian Christian movements, red flags that signal danger - such as the number of ex-elders and excommunicated members, and how one might feel to leave and come back just to visit any Christian group - and healthy steps toward healing.

Although this video and these readings are specifically dedicated to the devastated believers who have been hurt by such groups, movements, and leaders, this video is also for those who may be in leadership roles or who are complicit with leaders in any high-control, authoritarian Christian group. 

I hope all of our hearts could be guided into healthy Christian living and community, no longer dominated by men with a psychological need to control.

episodes.title: Glory & Shame
episodes.description:
On my way to the stables today, a recent favorite song came on the radio, "Something Better" (by Blanca, with Tauren Wells). As I considered that song, and the sermon I heard this morning, in which was mentioned that God gets all the glory, I considered the matter of glory and shame. If God gets ALL the glory, and Satan gets ALL the shame, then there really is no reason for any problems among believers. 

If ALL glory goes to God, then we don't have an "image" we are trying to protect. We care for the truth, for righteousness, for loving treatment of others because GOD cares about those things, and we are in His image... but we don't seek to GAIN glory from ANY person, nor do we GIVE glory to ANY person.

I believe ALL problems among believers are due to our giving anyone other than God the glory, and due to people thinking that any admission of guilt or fault is somehow shameful (and if people are seeking glory, they can't bear to be associated with shame...). 

Confessing (admitting) our sins - telling the truth, God then gets the glory; He solved our problems of sins! Jesus died that our sins could ALL be forgiven! And Satan gets all the shame - because he is the loser who comes to break in, kill, destroy, divide, damage, abuse, harrass, lie about.... precious image bearers of God.

Narcissism, I believe, is people, hiding a lot of deep inner shame, trying to get glory. And divisions and many problems among believers occur when people give man glory - not God alone - which is idolatry. 

Let's give God ALL the glory, let's cast all blame and shame on the evil one, Satan. The enemy of God has no place in the light, where there is love and truth and life.... So, let's be honest, truthful, repenting of any sin to one another and to God... Oh, may the love and life of our Savior God flow among us and heal.

So I share a few of these thoughts in this video, and a couple songs to the beating of Ranger's hooves. :) 

Abba, YOURS is the glory! Amen.
